<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_suspend_connection:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN void
MHD_suspend_connection (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *const daemon = connection->daemon;

#ifdef MHD_USE_THREADS
  mhd_assert ( (! MHD_D_IS_USING_THREADS_ (daemon)) || \
               MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_ (daemon) || \
               MHD_thread_handle_ID_is_current_thread_ (daemon->tid) );
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Cannot suspend connections without " \
                  "enabling MHD_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME!\n"));
#ifdef UPGRADE_SUPPORT
  if (NULL != connection->urh)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Error: connection scheduled for \"upgrade\" cannot " \
                 "be suspended.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    return;
  }
#endif /* UPGRADE_SUPPORT */
  internal_suspend_connection_ (connection);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Cannot suspend connections without " \
                  "enabling MHD_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME!\n"));
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment. The code calls MHD_PANIC for an error condition; there is no direct or indirect call to MHD_suspend_connection shown. This would only violate Rule 17.2 if MHD_PANIC (or any function it calls) ultimately called MHD_suspend_connection, creating indirect recursion — verify that MHD_PANIC and the functions it may call do not call MHD_suspend_connection (or any function that calls it).
